title: Sri Lanka does not rule out fuel rationing: PM
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka cannot rule out rationing fuel, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said as monetary instability continued without a credible peg or working float.
Wickremesinghe said next month 530 million US dollars for fuel imports in June and over 3.0 billion dollars over the next six months.
For gas 250 million dollars were needed for the next six months.
Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said fuel issues have been reduced due to low stocks.
Usual daily diesel issues were 5,400 metric tonnes and petrol was 3,400 metric tonnes.
But diesel was reduced to 3,200 for diesel and 2,800 for petrol.
The CPC was giving priority to the Ceylon Electricity Board, Ceylon Transport Board, private buses and the Colombo Port.
However on June 9 and 10 ships would deliver and the central bank has agreed to pay.
